definition: in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
color/complexion/looks/variant of 彩[cai3]/variant of 採|采[cai3]
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: You look great today. What's happened?
sentences.chinese: 你看起來神采飛揚，發生什麼事了？

sentences.english: Can that time is really in high spirits.
sentences.chinese: 可那個時候，真的是神采飛揚的。

sentences.english: When I look in your eyes, I can feel the butterflies.
sentences.chinese: 當我看着你的眼睛，我能看到神采飛揚。

definition: to have an imposing or impressive appearance/impressive appearance/straight and impressive looking
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
to do something at one go/to flow smoothly
to have a highly retentive memory/to have sth imprinted in one's memory
to recover one's youthful vigor/to feel rejuvenated (idiom)
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
